An Executive Order imposes an additional 25 percent ad valorem tariff on all articles that are products of Mexico, effective February 4, 2025, to address the national emergency at the southern border.

This Executive Order establishes a reciprocal tariff to address large and persistent U.S. goods trade deficits caused by a lack of reciprocity in bilateral trade relationships and disparate tariff and non-tariff barriers.

This proclamation modifies the existing tariff system on imported automobiles and automobile parts to more effectively eliminate national security threats by adjusting duties based on domestic assembly and parts value.
